meanings.definition: To bend the head or body as a sign of respect or greeting.
meanings.sent1: She bowed to thank the kind teacher.
meanings.sent2: The performer bowed after a wonderful show.
meanings.sent3: The dog bowed to the cat, trying to make friends.
meanings.sent4: The trees bowed gracefully in the wind's dance.
meanings.sent5: He bowed deeply, showing his utmost respect.

meanings.definition: To play a stringed instrument with a bow.
meanings.sent1: The musician bowed the violin expertly.
meanings.sent2: She bowed the cello with passion and skill.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to bow the guitar, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The bow bowed across the strings, creating beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: He bowed the fiddle, filling the room with melody.

meanings.definition: Having a curved or arched shape.
meanings.sent1: The bowed tree branches swayed in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge had a bowed design for strength.
meanings.sent3: The bowed rainbow appeared after the rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: Her bowed back showed years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The bowed roof of the barn added charm to the farm.
